meanings.definition: To quote or cite from a source outside of the current text.
meanings.sent1: She always likes to outquote famous authors in her essays.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to outquote experts in academic papers.
meanings.sent3: The detective outquoted the suspect's alibi with evidence.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outquote historical documents amazed her history professor.
meanings.sent5: Outquoting reliable sources adds credibility to your argument.

meanings.definition: A quotation or citation from a source outside of the current text.
meanings.sent1: The article included an outquote from a renowned scientist.
meanings.sent2: In the bibliography, make sure to list all outquotes properly.
meanings.sent3: The outquote in the article made the readers question its validity.
meanings.sent4: His speech was impactful due to the powerful outquote he used.
meanings.sent5: The outquote highlighted the importance of referencing sources accurately.
